Count values in a character vector

Source: R/count-char.R
count.character.Rd

Method for dplyr::count()

# S3 method for character
count(x, sort = FALSE, prop = FALSE)

Arguments

x

A character vector.

sort

If TRUE, sort the result so that the most common values float to the top.

prop

If TRUE, compute the fraction of marginal table.

Value

A tibble of element counts

Examples

x <- sample(LETTERS)[rpois(1000, 10)]
table(x)
#> x
#>   C   D   E   G   I   J   K   L   M   N   O   P   Q   R   T   V   W   X   Y   Z 
#> 139  13   4 130   1  18  47   8  34  74  67  95  49 115   9  99   2   7   1  87 
dplyr::count(x)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 2
#>    x         n
#>    <chr> <int>
#>  1 C       139
#>  2 D        13
#>  3 E         4
#>  4 G       130
#>  5 I         1
#>  6 J        18
#>  7 K        47
#>  8 L         8
#>  9 M        34
#> 10 N        74
#> 11 O        67
#> 12 P        95
#> 13 Q        49
#> 14 R       115
#> 15 T         9
#> 16 V        99
#> 17 W         2
#> 18 X         7
#> 19 Y         1
#> 20 Z        87
dplyr::count(x, sort = TRUE, prop = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 3
#>    x         n       p
#>    <chr> <int>   <dbl>
#>  1 C       139 0.139  
#>  2 G       130 0.130  
#>  3 R       115 0.115  
#>  4 V        99 0.0991 
#>  5 P        95 0.0951 
#>  6 Z        87 0.0871 
#>  7 N        74 0.0741 
#>  8 O        67 0.0671 
#>  9 Q        49 0.0490 
#> 10 K        47 0.0470 
#> 11 M        34 0.0340 
#> 12 J        18 0.0180 
#> 13 D        13 0.0130 
#> 14 T         9 0.00901
#> 15 L         8 0.00801
#> 16 X         7 0.00701
#> 17 E         4 0.00400
#> 18 W         2 0.00200
#> 19 Y         1 0.00100
#> 20 I         1 0.00100
